title: Space-Farm Biodome Adventure #3
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Hydroponics Bay
rooms.description: A vast chamber filled with rows of vertical growing towers bathed in purple LED light. Nutrient mist hangs in the air, and the hum of water pumps echoes throughout. Warning lights flash red on several control panels. Through the transparent dome ceiling, you see the stars and the curve of Earth below.

items.name: main control panel
items.description: A digital interface displaying system diagnostics and warnings
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: CRITICAL - Oxygen levels dropping. CO2 scrubbers offline. Emergency protocol initiated. Refer to Chief Botanist Chen's maintenance logs for override procedures.

items.name: supply locker
items.description: A metal locker containing tools and equipment for biodome maintenance

items.name: maintenance logbook
items.description: A digital tablet with maintenance records
items.text: Chief Botanist Chen - Log Entry: The biodome was established in 2047, the year humanity first achieved sustainable space agriculture. Remember: I am Chen Wei, head of agricultural operations. Our crops are stored in the Seed Vault for preservation.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY'

items.name: grow tower A
items.description: A vertical hydroponic tower growing leafy greens

items.name: handwritten note
items.description: A note tucked between the growing trays
items.text: Emergency Note: If systems fail, the backup oxygen generator is in the Climate Control Room. The emergency shuttle is our only way out if life support completely fails.

items.name: equipment cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing specialized tools

items.name: multi_tool
items.description: A versatile repair tool for biodome systems

items.name: biodome operations manual
items.description: A comprehensive guide to biodome systems
items.text: BIODOME OPERATIONS: In emergency situations, personnel must access the Climate Control Room to restore life support. The emergency shuttle bay can be accessed once climate systems are stabilized. Chief Botanist Chen Wei has override authority for all systems.

items.name: pressure_sealed door
items.description: A heavy door leading to the Climate Control Room. The lock mechanism appears jammed.

rooms.name: Climate Control Room
rooms.description: A compact room filled with humming machinery, pipes, and monitoring screens. The walls are lined with environmental control systems. A large window shows the hydroponics bay beyond. Red emergency lights pulse rhythmically. The air feels thin, and you can hear the labored wheezing of failing oxygen generators.

items.name: backup oxygen generator
items.description: A large cylindrical machine with status lights and control buttons
items.text: OXYGEN GENERATOR STATUS: STANDBY MODE - Requires manual activation. Warning: Generator can only be activated by authorized personnel with proper credentials.

items.name: environmental monitoring station
items.description: A bank of screens displaying atmospheric data and system diagnostics
items.text: ATMOSPHERIC ANALYSIS: O2 levels at 14% and falling. CO2 at dangerous levels. Temperature stable. Recommendation: Activate backup systems immediately and proceed to emergency evacuation if restoration fails.

items.name: wall mounted cabinet
items.description: A glass-fronted cabinet containing emergency supplies

items.name: emergency protocol document
items.description: A laminated card with emergency procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In the event of life support failure, proceed to the Emergency Shuttle Bay. Access requires verification: Chief's name, crop storage location, and year of biodome establishment.

items.name: control desk
items.description: A desk with multiple drawers and a computer terminal

items.name: crew roster
items.description: A list of biodome personnel and their roles
items.text: BIODOME CREW MANIFEST: Chief Botanist - Chen Wei, Agricultural Engineer - Sarah Martinez, Systems Technician - James Park, Research Assistant - Dr. Yuki Tanaka. All personnel trained in emergency evacuation procedures.

items.name: shuttle bay access hatch
items.description: A reinforced hatch with a biometric scanner and security terminal. Three verification questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Enter Chief Botanist's full name:
password_questions.hint: Check the maintenance log and crew roster

password_questions.question: Where are crops stored for preservation?
password_questions.hint: The maintenance log mentions this location

password_questions.question: What year was the biodome established?
password_questions.hint: The maintenance log records the founding year

rooms.name: Emergency Shuttle Bay
rooms.description: You've made it to the emergency shuttle bay! A sleek escape shuttle sits on the launch platform, its engines already warming up in standby mode. Through the bay windows, Earth hangs like a blue marble against the black void of space. The shuttle's door is open, and the interior lights glow with a welcoming warmth. Safety at last.

items.name: emergency escape shuttle
items.description: A compact spacecraft designed for emergency evacuation, fully fueled and ready for launch

items.name: launch control console
items.description: A terminal displaying pre-flight checks and launch authorization
items.text: SHUTTLE STATUS: READY FOR LAUNCH - All systems nominal. Destination: Earth Orbital Station Alpha. Estimated flight time: 2 hours. Awaiting crew boarding.

rooms.win_message: You board the emergency shuttle and seal the hatch behind you. The engines roar to life as the bay doors open to the stars. The biodome emergency is behind you now as you accelerate toward Earth. Through the viewport, you watch the failing biodome grow smaller, its lights flickering in the darkness. You've escaped just in time. Mission accomplished - you win!
